sn56.39:4.1: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:4.2: They gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:4.3: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:5.1: Suppose there was a light tuft of cotton-wool or kapok which was taken up by the wind and landed on level ground.
sn56.39:5.2: The east wind wafts it west; the west wind wafts it east; the north wind wafts it south; and the south wind wafts it north.
sn56.39:5.4: It’s because the tuft of cotton-wool is so light.
sn56.39:5.5: In the same way, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:5.6: They gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:5.7: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:5.9: It’s because they haven’t seen the four noble truths.
sn56.39:6.1: There are ascetics and brahmins who truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:6.2: They don’t gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:6.3: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:7.1: Suppose there was an iron pillar or a boundary pillar with deep foundations, firmly embedded, immovable and unshakable.
sn56.39:7.2: Even if violent storms were to blow up out of the east, the west, the north, and the south,
sn56.39:7.5: they couldn’t make it shake or rock or tremble.
sn56.39:7.7: It’s because that boundary pillar is firmly embedded, with deep foundations.
sn56.39:7.8: In the same way, there are ascetics and brahmins who truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:7.9: They don’t gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:7.10: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:7.12: It’s because they have clearly seen the four noble truths.
sn56.39:7.14: The noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:8.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
